body_html:
Unfortunately, there are some second order effects to specifying an SOVERSION.

The most pressing one is that a set SOVERSION traditionally sets up the following structure for the installed libraries: libATen.so.1, and a symlink from libATen.so. Unfortunately, this does not play to well with pip: when packaged, the symlink is eliminated, and you end up distributing two copies of the library (doubling the download size). So we can't take a patch like this without at the very least solving this problem.

More context: #8132

body:
Unfortunately, there are some second order effects to specifying an SOVERSION.

The most pressing one is that a set SOVERSION traditionally sets up the following structure for the installed libraries: `libATen.so.1`, and a symlink from `libATen.so`. Unfortunately, this does not play to well with pip: when packaged, the symlink is eliminated, and you end up distributing two copies of the library (doubling the download size). So we can't take a patch like this without at the very least solving this problem.

More context: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/8132
